name: 3dFDR
author: AFNI Developers
description: A tool for applying False Discovery Rate (FDR) thresholding to voxelwise statistics in 3D functional datasets.

inputs.description: Use mask values from file mname. If file mname contains more than 1 sub-brick, the mask sub-brick must be specified. Generally should be used to avoid counting non-brain voxels.
inputs.name: Mask file

inputs.description: Only voxels whose corresponding mask value is greater than or equal to the specified value in absolute terms will be considered. Default is 1.
inputs.name: Mask threshold

inputs.description: Set constant c(N): 1 for independent p-values (default) or sum(1/i, i=1,...,N) for any joint distribution.
inputs.name: Constant type

inputs.description: Write sorted list of voxel q-values to screen.
inputs.name: List flag

inputs.description: Use 'pname' for the output dataset prefix name.
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Use the old or new mode of operation. 'new' is now the default.
inputs.name: Mode option

inputs.description: Ignore p=1 voxels (default in new mode).
inputs.name: P-mask flag

inputs.description: Count p=1 voxels (default in old mode).
inputs.name: No P-mask flag

inputs.description: Force conversion of all sub-bricks, treating them as p-values.
inputs.name: Force flag

inputs.description: Force the output of z-scores in floating point format.
inputs.name: Float flag

inputs.description: Force the output of q-values rather than z-scores.
inputs.name: Q-value flag
